content: this is a summary of a civil case that took place in september 2023 at the taurage district court the court made a final decision regarding the division of matrimonial property in a divorce case the defendant was ordered to pay a total of 174.28 EUR which included stamp duty court fees and professional fees the court awarded various properties to the defendant including a dwelling house woodshed shed barn and well the court also recognized that the defendant is personally responsible for a certain debt the text discusses various aspects of matrimonial property and the obligations and rights of spouses the applicant sought a divorce and requested the division of marital property the court granted the defendant various properties and recognized their personal debt the applicant renounced their share of the marital property and did not seek compensation the court established that the parties were married and have minor children the applicant provided evidence of the properties owned by both parties the court must decide on the division of the spouses community property and the dissolution of the marriage the applicant requested the defendant to contest the division of properties and be held personally liable for the debt owed to the state tax inspectorate the court also decided on the costs of the proceedings with the defendant being ordered to pay the costs of legal aid stamp duty and court costs the grant application for the divorce was approved and the marriage is being dissolved the applicant will keep their married name after the divorce the immovable property acquired during the marriage will be divided with the defendant receiving certain personal property items the defendant is also recognized as being personally liable for a debt owed to the state tax inspectorate the defendant is ordered to pay stamp duty and costs related to the legal proceedings as well as the costs of secondary legal aid

metadata.financial_support: EUR 51 legal compensation for the proceedings
